documents.title: 2024 Security Audit Report - Executive Summary
documents.content: This executive summary highlights critical vulnerabilities identified during Q1 2024. The audit revealed 3 high-severity issues requiring immediate attention. For technical implementation details, see Technical Implementation Guide (doc_002). Risk assessment methodology is documented in Security Assessment Framework (doc_003). Remediation timeline and resource allocation are outlined in Remediation Roadmap (doc_004).

documents.title: Technical Implementation Guide - Authentication System
documents.content: The authentication system implements OAuth 2.0 with JWT tokens. Current implementation has a critical vulnerability in token validation logic (CVE-2024-001). The vulnerability allows token reuse beyond expiration. Fix requires updating the TokenValidator class in auth_service module. Related security controls are documented in Access Control Policy (doc_005). Testing procedures are outlined in Security Testing Procedures (doc_006).

documents.title: Security Assessment Framework
documents.content: Our security assessment framework follows OWASP Top 10 and NIST guidelines. Assessment includes automated scanning, manual penetration testing, and code review. Vulnerability severity is classified using CVSS v3.1 scoring. High-severity issues (CVSS > 7.0) trigger immediate remediation workflows. The complete assessment checklist is available in Assessment Checklist (doc_007).

documents.title: Remediation Roadmap Q1 2024
documents.content: Remediation timeline spans 6 weeks with phased deployment. Week 1-2: Fix authentication vulnerabilities (doc_002). Week 3-4: Implement additional security controls (doc_005). Week 5-6: Comprehensive testing and validation (doc_006). Resource allocation: 3 senior engineers, 2 security specialists. Budget approval documented in Budget Allocation (doc_008).

documents.title: Access Control Policy
documents.content: Access control implements role-based access control (RBAC) with principle of least privilege. Users are assigned roles: Admin, Developer, Auditor, ReadOnly. Admin role has full system access. Authentication requirements are detailed in Technical Implementation Guide (doc_002). Policy compliance is audited quarterly per Security Audit Report (doc_001).

documents.title: Security Testing Procedures
documents.content: Testing includes unit tests, integration tests, and penetration testing. Authentication tests verify token validation, session management, and access control. Test suite runs on every commit via CI/CD pipeline. Manual penetration testing conducted quarterly. Testing framework setup documented in Testing Infrastructure Guide (doc_009).

documents.title: Security Assessment Checklist
documents.content: Comprehensive checklist covering: Authentication mechanisms, Authorization controls, Data encryption, Input validation, Session management, Error handling, Logging and monitoring. Each item includes pass/fail criteria and remediation guidance. Checklist aligns with Security Assessment Framework (doc_003).

documents.title: Q1 2024 Security Budget Allocation
documents.content: Total budget: $250,000. Breakdown: Engineering resources $150,000, Security tools $50,000, External audits $30,000, Training $20,000. Budget approved by CTO and CFO. Allocation supports Remediation Roadmap (doc_004) deliverables.

documents.title: Testing Infrastructure Guide
documents.content: Testing infrastructure uses Jenkins for CI/CD, Selenium for UI testing, and OWASP ZAP for security scanning. Environment includes staging and production mirrors. Test data is anonymized per Data Privacy Policy (doc_010). Infrastructure maintained by DevOps team.

documents.title: Data Privacy Policy
documents.content: Policy ensures GDPR and CCPA compliance. Personal data is encrypted at rest and in transit. Data retention: 90 days for logs, 7 years for audit trails. Privacy impact assessments conducted for new features. Related to Access Control Policy (doc_005).
